item.item: The namespace is a term reference which groups related identifiers, prepended to the local identifier it constitutes the object global persistent identifier.
The local identifier is a string that uniquely identifies the object within a namespace or collection.

Persistent identifiers are unique across namespaces, they are global, in that they include the namespace and they are persistent. In general, this identifier is the concatenation of the namespace and the local identifier.

This attribute is a string which represents the persistent global identifier of the object that is considered the valid choice. This is generally used by legacy or obsolete objects for referring to the valid, current or official object.

This attribute is an integer sequence number which is automatically assigned just before the object is committed. This represents an identifier unique to the collection to which the object belongs. This identifier is not persistent, in that it depends on the order in which the object was committed.
This attribute is an integer value which uniquely identifies the element that represents the current object in a graph or ontology.

This attribute is an enumerated value which represents the unit domain, it indicates the type or nature of a unit object. This property is used to disambiguate objects of different domains within a single collection.
This attribute is a string which references or identifies the entity which is responsible for the information and identification of a unit object.
The collection is a string that identifies the group to which a unit object belongs, it allows to disambiguate homonym unit identifiers belonging to the same domain.
The identifier is a string that uniquely identifies a unit object among all those that share the same domain and collection.

This attribute is a string representing a version or an iteration of a unit object. It is generally used to identify different versions of the same unit by disambiguating duplicate identifiers, or to provide a time-stamp to the unit's information.
This attribute is a list of strings representing alternate identifiers which refer to the object and that are not formally defined in the current data set.
This attribute holds a string representing a tag object reference, it is the tag native identifier of the tag object it references.
This attribute holds a list of strings representing tag object references, these elements are the native identifiers of the tag objects they reference.
This attribute holds a string representing a term object reference, it is the native identifier of the term object it references.

This attribute holds a list of strings representing term object references, these elements are the native identifiers of the term objects they reference. The order in which these elements are set is significant: this list generally represents a lexical construct.
This attribute describes the subject of a relationship, it holds an integer representing a node native identifier which is a reference to a node object through its sequence number.
This attribute describes the reference to a node stored in a graph database which represents the subject node of the relationship.
This attribute describes the predicate of a relationship, it holds a string representing a term native identifier which qualifies the relationship between two vertices.
This attribute describes the object of a relationship, it holds an integer representing a node native identifier which is a reference to a node object through its sequence number.
This attribute describes the reference to a node stored in a graph database which represents the object node of the relationship.
This attribute holds a reference to an entity object.

This attribute holds a value representing a reference to an object of the same class as the holder. Master objects represent either the master copy of the object, or an object that contains information shared by several alias objects, which are those featuring this property.
This attribute holds an enumerated set of term object references which represent the different categories to which the object belongs.

This attribute holds an enumerated set of term object references which indicate the data type of the data property. This type corresponds to the primitive data representation and structure of the data property.

This attribute holds an enumerated set of term object references which indicate the cardinality and requirements of the data property. This type corresponds to the attributes of the data property, not to its type.
This attribute holds an enumerated set of term object references which qualify the type and context of a term object.
This attribute holds an enumerated set of term object references which qualify the type and context of a node object.
This attribute holds a string representing the name of the object. This is generally the way humans refer to the object and it is not related to a specific language.
This attribute holds a list of strings representing labels of an object the several languages. Each element holds the language in which the label is expressed in and the text of the label.

This attribute holds a list of texts representing definitions of an object in several languages. Each element holds the language in which the definition is expressed in and the text of the definition. A definition should provide detailed information on an object without reference to the context.

This attribute holds a list of texts representing descriptions of the object in several languages. Each element holds the language in which the description is expressed in and the text of the description. A description should add context related information to the definition of the object.
This attribute holds a series of notes or comments in a single text unrelated to a specific language.
This attribute holds an integer value representing the number of unit objects featuring the current property. This is generally used to assess tag usage frequency in unit objects.
This attribute holds an integer value representing the number of tag objects featuring the current property. This is generally used to assess tag usage frequency in entity objects.
This attribute holds an integer value representing the number of tag objects referencing the current object.
This attribute holds an integer value representing the number of term objects referencing the current object.
This attribute holds an integer value representing the number of node objects referencing the current object.
This attribute holds an integer value representing the number of edge objects referencing the current object.
An array of strings representing the set of offset paths in which the holding tag was referenced as a leaf offset in tag objects. This property is held exclusively by tag objects.
An array of strings representing the set of offset paths in which the holding tag was referenced as a leaf offset in term objects. This property is held exclusively by tag objects.
An array of strings representing the set of offset paths in which the holding tag was referenced as a leaf offset in node objects. This property is held exclusively by tag objects.
An array of strings representing the set of offset paths in which the holding tag was referenced as a leaf offset in edge objects. This property is held exclusively by tag objects.
An array of strings representing the set of offset paths in which the holding tag was referenced as a leaf offset in entity objects. This property is held exclusively by tag objects.
An array of strings representing the set of offset paths in which the holding tag was referenced as a leaf offset in unit objects. This property is held exclusively by tag objects.
This attribute holds a list of elements in which the first item indicates a tag sequence number and the second item lists the offset paths in which the tag is used as a leaf offset.
This attribute holds a list of elements in which the the key represents the tag sequence number and the value is the list offset paths in which the tag is used as a leaf offset.
This property holds an array indexed by collection name holding as value the list of native identifiers of objects referenced by the holding object in that collection.
This property holds a tag object native identifier that must be of structure type, properties defined by the current tag must be stored in the offset referenced by the value of this property.

This property should only be featured by structure list tags, it holds a tag object native identifier referencing the structure offset acting as the list index. This means that no two structure elements of a list may share the same value in the property referenced by this attribute.
This attribute holds a string which represents the type of the current element.
This attribute holds a string which represents the language name or code of the current element.
This attribute holds a string which represents the text of the current element.
This attribute holds a string which represents the URL of the current element.
This attribute holds a floating point number which represents the lower boundary of a range.
This attribute holds a floating point number which represents the upper boundary of a range.
This attribute holds a regular expression string which represents the validation of a string.
This attribute holds a geometric shape which represents the geographic location and geometry of an object.

This attribute holds the geometric shape which represents the available geographic location and geometry of an object. This may not coincide with the actual location and shape of the object, due to restrictions or approximations.
This attribute holds a string which identifies the network connection protocol or scheme.
This attribute holds a string which identifies the network connection domain name or internet address.
This attribute holds an integer which identifies the network TCP or UDP port number.
This attribute holds a string which identifies the user code used to authenticate with the service.
This attribute holds a string which identifies the user password used to authenticate with the service.
This attribute holds a string which identifies the database.
This attribute holds a string which identifies the database collection.
This attribute holds a list of key/value pairs which represent the network connection options. The key part identifies the option, the value part provides the option value.
This attribute holds a string representing the first name of the entity.
This attribute holds a string representing the last name of the entity.
This attribute holds an enumerated set describing the various types of the holding entity.
This attribute holds an enumerated set describing the various kinds of the holding entity.
This attribute holds the list of acronyms used by the entity.
This attribute holds the entity list of mailing addresses discriminated by type.
This attribute holds the entity list of e-mail addresses discriminated by type.
This attribute holds the entity list of internet addresses discriminated by type.
This attribute holds the entity list of telephone numbers discriminated by type.
This attribute holds the entity list of telefax numbers discriminated by type.
This attribute holds the list of entities to which the current object is affiliated, discriminated by type.
This attribute holds the country of the entity, this is expressed as an ISO country code.
This attribute holds the reference to the valid, current or preferred entity. This is used to keep track of historical entity records when these entities become obsolete or defunct.
